perturbation.original_text: 4.1 PC Financial shall pay a monthly Fee to Mobimagic in accordance with this Agreement and within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 PC Financial shall pay a monthly Fee to Mobimagic in accordance with this Agreement, with payment due 120 days after receipt of Mobimagic's invoice.
perturbation.explanation: According to the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development (MSMED) Act, 2006 in India, if the buyer doesn't specify a payment timeline, they are required to make the payment to MSMEs within 45 days. Changing the payment term to 120 days contradicts this regulation, making the payment term legally non-compliant.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development (MSMED) Act, 2006, India

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. PC Financial shall pay to Mobimagic a fixed service fee in the amount of 970,000 United States Dollars (USD 970,000) for each month (the "Fee") within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations. It is stipulated in this Agreement that Mobimagic will send an invoice to PC Financial on monthly basis according to the progress of the service. After PC Financial confirms that invoice contents are correct, PC Financial shall pay within 45 days after confirming thus.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. PC Financial shall pay to Mobimagic a fixed service fee in the amount of 970,000 United States Dollars (USD 970,000) for each month (the "Fee"). PC Financial shall pay within 90 days after confirming the invoice, regardless of any regulations.
perturbation.explanation: As mentioned above, according to the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development (MSMED) Act, 2006 in India, if the buyer doesn't specify a payment timeline, they are required to make the payment to MSMEs within 45 days. Changing the payment term to 90 days contradicts this regulation, making the payment term legally non-compliant. This becomes a legal contradiction when it is stated as 'regardless of any regulations'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development (MSMED) Act, 2006, India

perturbation.original_text: 7. CONFIDENTIALITY & PUBLICITY Neither Party shall disclose the other Party's Confidential Information to any third party or use Confidential Information for any purpose other than fur the proper fulfillment of this Agreement. Each Party undertakes to safeguard the Confidential Information of the other Party with the same degree of care as it would apply to Its own Confidential Information and, in any case, with no less than reasonable care. Such obligations will survive the expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years.
perturbation.changed_text: 7. CONFIDENTIALITY & PUBLICITY Neither Party shall disclose the other Party's Confidential Information to any third party or use Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the proper fulfillment of this Agreement. Each Party undertakes to safeguard the Confidential Information of the other Party with the same degree of care as it would apply to its own Confidential Information and, in any case, with no less than reasonable care. Such obligations will survive the expiration of this Agreement for a period of one (1) year.
perturbation.explanation: While the original contract states confidentiality obligations will survive for a period of five years, reducing this to one year could be considered unreasonably short, particularly considering the nature of the information involved (business methods, marketing strategies, pricing, competitor information, product development strategies, and financial results). This could contradict established legal precedent or industry norms in India regarding the protection of trade secrets and confidential business information, especially concerning the competitive disadvantage the disclosing party might face. The one year period doesn't allow reasonable time to take legal actions in case there is an infraction of confidentiality, thus being non-compliant.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Indian Contract Act, 1872 and principles of reasonable restrictions on trade and protection of trade secrets
